claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination broadened antigen display in tumors, increasing the fraction of tumor proteins observed in the immunopeptidome.

evidence.quote: | Fraction of tumor proteins represented in immunopeptidome | 62.3% | 37.3% | Broader antigen display after intratumoral mRNA vaccination |
3. A broader peptide repertoire appears on MHC-I, improving tumor visibility to T cells.

claims.caveat: The report notes that some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination was associated with an expanded MHC-I peptidome, consistent with increased antigen processing and presentation.

evidence.quote: | Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome | 40.6% | 20.6% | Strong expansion of MHC-I-presented landscape |
2. Interferon-associated antigen processing and presentation pathways increase.

claims.caveat: Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors, limiting direct clinical extrapolation from these measurements.

claims.claim: Type I interferon signaling is a key mediator of the sensitization effect produced by intratumoral mRNA vaccination.

evidence.quote: 1. Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling.
- Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated the observed sensitization benefit.
| Type I interferon response score (normalized units) | 3.1 | 1.0 | Marked induction after mRNA vaccination in tumors |

claims.caveat: The study includes perturbation controls, but mechanistic effects may still vary by tumor model and may not generalize across all settings.

claims.claim: Vaccination increased PD-L1 pathway activity in tumor tissue, providing a rationale for combining intratumoral mRNA vaccination with anti-PD-L1 therapy.

evidence.quote: | PD-L1 expression fold-change in tumor tissue | 2.4x | 1.0x | Checkpoint axis became more targetable |
4. PD-L1 pathway activity also increases, creating a rationale for combining with checkpoint blockade.

claims.caveat: Changes in PD-L1 expression do not by themselves prove improved clinical response, and the report emphasizes limits to causal interpretation.

claims.claim: In a retrospective metastatic patient cohort treated with ICIs, prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination was associated with improved survival.

evidence.quote: - Translational arm: a retrospective cohort of metastatic patients receiving ICI treatment, compared by prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination status.
| Retrospective human survival comparison p-value | p=0.01 | N/A | Vaccinated subgroup had improved survival under ICI treatment |
- The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely.

claims.caveat: Because the human comparison is retrospective with variable vaccination timing and heterogeneous tumors/treatment histories, the association cannot be interpreted as causal.
